item.title: More Than Memory: Coping With The Other Ills Of Alzheimer's
item.description: June 24, 2017 - Many people with Alzheimer's suffer medical and mental health issues that have nothing to do with memory loss, including slow healing, incontinence, paranoia and depression.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 24, 2017 - Many people with Alzheimer's suffer medical and mental health issues that have nothing to do with memory loss, including slow healing, incontinence, paranoia and depression. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/24/525887392/more-than-memory-coping-with-the-other-ills-of-alzheimers

item.title: How The Senate Health Care Bill Could Disrupt The Insurance Market
item.description: June 24, 2017 - In their Affordable Care Act repeal bill, Senate Republicans dropped the requirement that all Americans get health insurance. But they also kept the mandate that insurance companies cover everyone.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 24, 2017 - In their Affordable Care Act repeal bill, Senate Republicans dropped the requirement that all Americans get health insurance. But they also kept the mandate that insurance companies cover everyone. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/24/534153075/how-the-senate-health-care-bill-could-disrupt-the-insurance-market

item.title: NFL's Jermichael Finley On Head Trauma: 'It Felt Like 100 Bees Stinging Me'
item.description: June 23, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers speaks with former NFL tight end Jermichael Finley about his experience living with the effects of head trauma sustained on the field.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers speaks with former NFL tight end Jermichael Finley about his experience living with the effects of head trauma sustained on the field. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/23/534143125/nfls-jermichael-finley-on-head-trauma-it-felt-like-100-bees-stinging-me

item.title: President Trump Praises Senate Republican Health Care Bill
item.description: June 23, 2017 - President Trump is praising the Senate's health care bill. But the bill lacks a mechanism requiring people to have continuous coverage, which could create problems in the individual health care market.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - President Trump is praising the Senate's health care bill. But the bill lacks a mechanism requiring people to have continuous coverage, which could create problems in the individual health care market. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/23/534143104/president-trump-praises-senate-republican-health-care-bill

item.title: What The Man Who Ran Obamacare Thinks About The Republican Health Care Plan
item.description: June 23, 2017 - Andy Slavitt was acting administrator of the the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services until January. He calls the new Senate health care bill "the ugly step-sibling" of the House bill.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - Andy Slavitt was acting administrator of the the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services until January. He calls the new Senate health care bill "the ugly step-sibling" of the House bill. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/23/534106319/what-the-man-who-ran-obamacare-thinks-about-the-republican-health-plan

item.title: Efforts Increase To Bring Health And Other Benefits To Independent Workers
item.description: June 23, 2017 - The vast majority of the estimated 54 million to 68 million contingent or independent workers in the U.S. don't receive employee benefits, though some firms and lawmakers are trying to change that.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - The vast majority of the estimated 54 million to 68 million contingent or independent workers in the U.S. don't receive employee benefits, though some firms and lawmakers are trying to change that. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/22/533943837/efforts-increase-to-bring-health-and-other-benefits-to-independent-workers

item.title: Could The Best Memory System Be One That Forgets?
item.description: June 23, 2017 - Forget thinking about forgetting as failure. Researchers now say that ridding our brains of irrelevant details and outdated information helps us better navigate our ever-changing world.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - Forget thinking about forgetting as failure. Researchers now say that ridding our brains of irrelevant details and outdated information helps us better navigate our ever-changing world. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/23/534001592/could-the-best-memory-system-be-one-that-forgets

item.title: The AMA's Take On GOP Health Care Plan
item.description: June 23, 2017 - Rachel Martin talks with David Barbe, a family doctor in rural Missouri and president of the American Medical Association, about the Senate health care proposal.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 23, 2017 - Rachel Martin talks with David Barbe, a family doctor in rural Missouri and president of the American Medical Association, about the Senate health care proposal. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/23/534056758/the-amas-take-on-gop-health-care-plan

item.title: When You Talk In Your Sleep, Are You Talking To Your Secret Self?
item.description: June 22, 2017 - After hearing recordings of herself giggling and cheerfully talking in her sleep, Tanya Marquardt, who always thought of herself as tough and brooding, begins to connect with her other self.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - After hearing recordings of herself giggling and cheerfully talking in her sleep, Tanya Marquardt, who always thought of herself as tough and brooding, begins to connect with her other self. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/22/533952361/when-you-talk-in-your-sleep-are-you-talking-to-your-secret-self

item.title: OB-GYNs Give Women More Say In When They Have Mammograms
item.description: June 22, 2017 - Updated guidelines on mammograms from the nation's gynecologists are intended to incorporate recommendations from three other medical societies and consider women's preferences, too.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - Updated guidelines on mammograms from the nation's gynecologists are intended to incorporate recommendations from three other medical societies and consider women's preferences, too. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/22/533951718/ob-gyns-give-women-more-say-in-when-they-have-mammograms

item.title: Ohio Health Insurance CEO Raises Concerns Over Senate GOP Bill
item.description: June 22, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers talks with Pam Morris, CEO and President of CareSource, about the new health care bill from Senate Republicans. CareSource is the largest provider of Medicaid managed care services for Ohio.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers talks with Pam Morris, CEO and President of CareSource, about the new health care bill from Senate Republicans. CareSource is the largest provider of Medicaid managed care services for Ohio. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/22/533989383/ohio-health-insurance-ceo-raises-concerns-over-senate-gop-bill

item.title: Republican Sen. John Thune Defends Senate Health Care Bill
item.description: June 22, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers interviews Republican Sen. John Thune of South Dakota, who was one of the people who worked on the Senate health care bill, about the last minute negotiations and the finished product.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers interviews Republican Sen. John Thune of South Dakota, who was one of the people who worked on the Senate health care bill, about the last minute negotiations and the finished product. http://www.npr.org/2017/06/22/533989362/republican-sen-john-thune-defends-senate-health-care-bill

item.title: Senate Republican Leaders Unveil Proposed Health Care Legislation
item.description: June 22, 2017 - Senate Republicans unveiled a draft of their health care bill on Thursday. Party leaders are hoping for a vote on the legislation next week.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Democratic Sen. Claire McCaskill Reacts To Senate GOP Health Care Bill
item.description:
June 22, 2017 - NPR's Audie Cornish talks to Democratic Sen. Claire McCaskill about the Senate Republican health care bill.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/06/22/533989326/democratic-sen-claire-mccaskill-reacts-to-senate-gop-health-care-bill

item.title: CHART: Who Wins, Who Loses With Senate Health Care Bill
item.description: June 22, 2017 - Senate Republicans are calling their health care bill the Better Care Reconciliation Act. It shares many provisions with the House's American Health Care Act, but goes further in cutting Medicaid.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: June 22, 2017 - Senate Republicans are calling their health care bill the Better Care Reconciliation Act. It shares many provisions with the House's American Health Care Act, but goes further in cutting Medicaid. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/06/22/533942041/who-wins-who-loses-with-senate-health-care-bill
